A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: An utter betrayal of everything that was painstakingly created by George Lucas and the Original Trilogy's cast/staff. So afraid of itself that it serves to sabotage any semblance of mythos that \"The Force Awakens\" had built all for the sake of cheap thrills and manipulative storytelling. The Prequel Trilogy may have been flawed but it had heart and ambition; a direct antithesis to the self-deprecating writing and characterization depicted in this film. If you didn't think that Star Wars died at any point in time before\, this entry serves to definitively mark itself in history as the final nail in the coffin.
